articles.headline: Gwyneth Paltrow, Angelina Jolie and Others Say Weinstein Harassed Them
articles.snippet: “This way of treating women ends now,” Ms. Paltrow said as she and other actresses accused the producer of casting-couch abuses.
articles.abstract: “This way of treating women ends now,” Ms. Paltrow said as she and other actresses accused the producer of casting-couch abuses.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Gwyneth Paltrow was 22 years old, she got a role that would take her from actress to star: The film producer Harvey Weinstein hired her for the lead in the Jane Austen adaptation “Emma.” Before shooting began, he summoned her to his suite at the Peninsula Beverly Hills hotel for a work meeting that began uneventfully.
articles.byline: By Jodi Kantor and Rachel Abrams

articles.headline: Puerto Rico’s Health Care Is in Dire Condition, Three Weeks After Maria
articles.snippet: As the island struggles to recover from the devastation of Hurricane Maria, sick people remain in mortal peril. Hospitals are short of medicines, power supplies and staff.
articles.abstract: As the island struggles to recover from the devastation of Hurricane Maria, sick people remain in mortal peril. Hospitals are short of medicines, power supplies and staff.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAGUAS, P.R. — Harry Figueroa, a teacher who went a week without the oxygen that helped him breathe, died here last week at 58. His body went unrefrigerated for so long that the funeral director could not embalm his badly decomposed corpse.

articles.headline: The Frightful Five Want to Rule Entertainment. They Are Hitting Limits.
articles.snippet: Apple, Google and other tech giants are pushing deeper into cultural industries — and stumbling in ways that suggest a certain cluelessness.
articles.abstract: Apple, Google and other tech giants are pushing deeper into cultural industries — and stumbling in ways that suggest a certain cluelessness.
articles.lead_paragraph: The tech giants are too big. Other than Donald J. Trump, that’s the defining story of 2017, the meta-narrative lurking beneath every other headline.

articles.headline: Rohingya Recount Atrocities: ‘They Threw My Baby Into a Fire’
articles.snippet: The New York Times visited refugee camps where civilians described a campaign of slaughter and rape by Myanmar’s military.
articles.abstract: The New York Times visited refugee camps where civilians described a campaign of slaughter and rape by Myanmar’s military.
articles.lead_paragraph: COX’S BAZAR, Bangladesh — Hundreds of women stood in the river, held at gunpoint, ordered not to move.
